buildup.text: Raymond Damadian showed that magnetic resonance could distinguish tumors from healthy tissue in 1971.

discovery.text: MRI uses powerful magnets and radio waves to create detailed images without a single X-ray.

twist.text: The first human MRI scan took nearly five hours. Today it takes minutes.

climax.text: MRI revolutionized diagnosisâ€”doctors could see soft tissues, brains, and organs in living patients.

punchline.text: Magnets showed us what scalpels never could.
